channel.title: Steam, non Valve games bought in stores
channel.description:
I was just wondering, if I buy a game at for example Gamestop or any other shop for that matter, can I activate it on steam?
Consider that the game is also available in the Steam store of course.

item.title: Steam, non Valve games bought in stores
item.dc:creator: @PeterMan PeterMan
item.description:
@PeterMan wrote:

Thanks everyone. I believe CoD4 will work, since it’s such a “big” game.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: June 25, 2009, 07:33:05 pm[/size][hr]Anyways, landed on buying CoD:WaW on Steam.

The CoD4 offer was over now anyways.

Read full topic
item.source: Steam, non Valve games bought in stores

item.title: Steam, non Valve games bought in stores
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Only some of them though. For example, I got a retail copy of Lost Planet with a video card I bought, and after installing it manually with the DVD I activated it on steam and now I can install it through steam on any other computer I have steam on, just like CSS which I bought through steam. However, Enemy Territory: Quake Wars, which I bought in a store and you can also buy through steam, will not let me do the same thing, so I can only install it via the DVD. (fine with me though, I just play it in linux anyway)

Read full topic
item.source: Steam, non Valve games bought in stores

item.title: Steam, non Valve games bought in stores
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“PeterMan, post:5, topic:285054”][quote author=T4_ link=topic=376746.msg2838148#msg2838148 date=1245795732]

I was just wondering, if I buy a game at for example Gamestop or any other shop for that matter, can I activate it on steam?

Consider that the game is also available in the Steam store of course.

I have never done it, but Steam claims you can.
[/quote]
Where does it say so, I haven’t seen it :S

Only tried with Valve games, such as TF2 and CSS.[/quote]
I believe it’s titled ‘Add purchased game’ or something.

Read full topic

item.title: Steam, non Valve games bought in stores
item.dc:creator: @PeterMan PeterMan
item.description:
@PeterMan wrote:

eczema3:

The games are all cheaper on Steam anyway, I don’t see why you wouldn’t buy them there.

Nah, not all games.

E.g CoD4 costs 49.99 euro (455 Norwegian Kroner) on Steam , but I have seen it for 299 Norwegian Kroner in a shop at the mall near me.

Read full topic
